head.title: A Look Into the Mirror of Race

hedline.hl1: A Look Into the Mirror of Race

abstract.p: Kimberly Harms letter says white suburban young males who embrace hip hop should be helping other young people get out of ghetto life rather than play-acting at living in it (July 6 article)

block.p: Re ''Guarding the Borders of the Hip-Hop Nation'' (''How Race Is Lived in America,'' front page, July 6):

After reading your article I remain mystified as to why a segment of young, affluent, white suburban males find hip-hop, with its glorification of violence, misogyny, crime, drugs and gang life, so appealing.
Re ''Guarding the Borders of the Hip-Hop Nation'' (''How Race Is Lived in America,'' front page, July 6):

After reading your article I remain mystified as to why a segment of young, affluent, white suburban males find hip-hop, with its glorification of violence, misogyny, crime, drugs and gang life, so appealing.

If Billy Wimsatt, who embraced hip-hop, and others like him are so determined to break out of their comfortable suburban life and improve race relations in America, I suggest that they do some real work and make a commitment to volunteer programs that seek to end poverty and help young people out of ghetto life rather than play-act living in it.
